page.title: 05Farming-Witton & Ridligton
page.content: {Crops}Soil is medium loam,rich & easily worked:farming is mainly arable.Most important crops are sugar beet,processed at Cantley factory,wheat,barley & potatoes.Peas & brussels are grown under contract for freezing.Small areas of hay are for local use;permanent grassland mainly on low lying,damper ground. {Livestock}A herd of Fresian cows for fattening;small number of Suffolk cross sheep fattened;pigs intensively reared in old poultry houses near Ridlington Church.One farm produces eggs,another rears day-old chicks to point of lay,both by intensive systems. {Fishing}At Walcott Gap part time fishermen own a few boats for inshore fishing.Catches include shrimps,cod & plaice.
